item.title: How many gene annotations are there?
item.description: How many gene annotations are there? Grace Blackwell recently gave a really interesting talk on her work Blackwell, G. A. et al. Exploring bacterial diversity via a curated and searchable snapshot of archived DNA sequences. Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory 2021.03.02.433662 (2021) doi:10.1101/2021.03.02.433662 generating a standardised and curated database of 661,405 bacterial genome assemblies using read data retrieved from the European Nucleotide Archive (ENA). This dataset is already proving to be very useful.
